dialogues.text: He flips over his "MERCEDES" tape to the "SLOW" side. He waits for it to begin. It's the perfect song for the perf moment. He smiles and adjusts the volume. BUT, just as he's about to slide cut, the sound garbles a dies. He ejects the tape. It's destroyed. He flips on the radio. The reception sucks. HE shuts it off and looks out at Mercedes filling her glass up. He needs music. He open the GLOVE COMPARTMENT.

dialogues.speaker: A ROW OF CASSETTES
dialogues.text: Grandfather's top ten: Como, Bennett, Torme, Sinatra, and Humperdinck. He grabs "Greatest Hits of the 40's" and loa it into the deck. "Strangers in the Night." Nestled in the woods, above the city, it's beautiful. I w it were me. Mercedes, deep in thought and alcohol, gulps away. An awkward moment for Les. He looks out at the spectacular view.

dialogues.speaker: SINATRA
dialogues.text: "Strangers in the night, exchanging glances, wondering in the night, what were the chances, we'd be sharing love, before the night was through."

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Do you want to dance?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: To this? Where?

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (getting up on the hood with her stiletto heels) Right up here. You couldn't pray for a more romantic setting. Her heels on the hood are killing him, but he doesn't wan upset the momentum. He hops up. They get close. She's taller. It's awkward.

dialogues.speaker: SINATRA
dialogues.text: ‘Love was just a glance away, a warm embracing dance away.'

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Maybe I should take my shoes off? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Les looks to the sky as if to say, "Thank you, God." They resume dancing. As Frankie sings on, they get closer and closer, until Mercedes attaches her mouth to Les'. Within moments they've eased themselves down onto the hood, and they're really going at it. Passion!

dialogues.speaker: SINATRA
dialogues.text: ‘It turned out so right, for strangers in the night.' As Frankie gets into his "doobee doobee doos," the song f and we hear a THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: His eves dart open. ANOTHER THUMP. It's the hood of the Cadillac caving in. He can't even kiss her now. ANOTHER THUMP! He pulls himself away, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Get up. Get off the hood.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: The hood is caving in. Quick, get off.

dialogues.speaker: SINATRA
dialogues.text: (the next song) ‘That’s life, that’s what people say.’ Les is destroyed. There's a huge deep dent in the hood.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I'll be making repair payments from Siberia. (packing up to go) We have to get this fixed.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (plastered -- drink in hand) What's the rush, Les? I love this song.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (more to himself) Unfortunately, so does my grandfather. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Les leaps into the car. Mercedes falls in. He tries ejecting the cassette, but it's jammed. He tries to get i out. Forget it. He lowers the volume. She won't let him start the car, she's all over him. She starts kissing his neck, unbuttoning his shirt, kissing his chest.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (sexy) You have such baby soft skin. He can't resist her. He begins to smile. Suddenly her hea drops into his lap. He winces... and then we hear some SNORING... He looks down. She's fast asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cluttered with spare parts, bikes, tools, you name it. Th Cadillac is parked beside the Datsun. The hood is up. Dea pounds the dent out from the inside. Charles, with a pock camera hung around his neck, watches. Les paces nervously

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You have balls, Les. You definitely have balls for snatching this car. I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Let's see the license.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's ugly.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Of course it is. Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (holding up his camera) Come on. Let me take a picture of it.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Okay. Dean turns around. Charles readies his camera. Les whips his open wallet by their noses. The camera FLASHES. Forge it. Radar couldn't have picked it up. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (rubbing his eyes from the flash) Happy, now?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (turning to the hood) Take a look. Dean puts the mallet down and gently drops the hood. Les crouches down to check. Dean stands, confident.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Excellent work, Dean. Really spectacular. You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: So I guess we can go to Archie's now?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Dean, I promise next weekend, but not tonight. Mercedes doesn't have to be home for a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les, take a look at something. Dean walks Les to the passenger side of the car. Mercedes out cold, her face squished up against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Unless you're into some intense kinky shit, and you never know after tonight, this Mercedes has a dead battery. Les is depressed. Dean's rolling.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: We're talking about Archie's Atomic, Les. It's in the middle of nowhere. You can't get there without a license. No buses, no trains, no planes. Only the slickest driving machines you've ever seen. Dean pulls a crumpled piece of paper out of his pocket an hands it to Les. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Here are the directions my brother gave me. Les glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: How do you know it's any good? You've never even been there.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Charles, do I tell you what kind of dictionaries to buy?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (looking for an out) I dunno, Dean. I'm a little tired, I don't feel like driving on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Are you shittin' me? You got your license twelve hours ago and you're already tired of driving? My mother makes ridiculous statements like that.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Forget it, Dean. I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Can't? Dean grabs the mallet and walks over to the hood. He lift the mallet high into the air, assuming the executioner's position.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Fine. But as precise and delicate a task as it may have appeared, fixing those dents... I could easily put them all back.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (nowhere to go) This place better be worth it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: The drive alone will be worth it.  65.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Backing out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (o.8.) Did you wipe your feet, Dean?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (o.8.; like a baby) Yes, I wiped the concrete off my feet. (sounding great) Two seconds in the car and I can already feel the change. This is too much. Charles, push in the lighter, I have a surprise for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Dean holds out three cigars. Behind him, we SEE Mercedes cold. Charles still has his camera around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: No way, Dean. Not in here.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les, this is a car, not an oxygen tent.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Forget it. If there's even the slightest evidence to suggest that I took this car, my dad will slaughter first and ask questions later. Dean bounces back into his seat, shaking his head. Quiet. Dean smirks... and then the loudest FART you've ever hear They crack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparsely crowded, the Caddie crawls along in the middle l at a tortoise's pace, being passed by cars, left and righ (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Sheer boredom. Charles takes it in stride. Dean watches incredulously as a JOGGER passes them on the right and a STREET SWEEPER passes them on the left.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les, how about taking the car out of neutral and putting it in gear? A bath is more exciting than this. Les takes it like a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stopped at a red light.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Dean has given up. We hear The Funeral March horn... "DUM DUM, DaDUM... DUM, DaDUM, DaDUM, DaDUM."

dialogues.speaker: THE GLOSSY BLACK GTO
dialogues.text: with the THREE DEMENTED HIGH SCHOOL DROPOUTS, pulls up be them REVVVVVVING its engine.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: The makings of a drag. This is what Dean has been waiting for. The stares. The challenge. Charles and Dean smirk at the DRIVER. Les revs his engine. Charles and Dean smile a Les... The light turns GREEN! Sorry boys. Les pulls away slowly, while the GTO screeche away leaving them in a cloud of burnt rubber.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What? Les are you sixteen, or are you sixty? You could've given that gear head a run for his money.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Dean, this is my grandfather's car. Get me a car that I'm not genetically related to, and I assure you things will change.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les. No one's asking you to break the sound barrier. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DEAN (cont'd) It just feels like we're on some sort of kiddie ride, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Give him a break, Dean. He just got his license.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: His tractor license. I mean what's the point? What's the damn point of driving a car if you're not going to take advantage of it?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to your beliefs about cars representing freedom in America?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: At twenty miles per hour?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What's the difference? Twenty, eighty, you're in a car.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: There's a big difference, Charles. Freedom at eighty miles per hour is America. Freedom at twenty miles per hour is communism. End of round one. The fighters return to their corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out. Windows open. Curtains blowing. Mom has the blankets off. Dad is wrapped in them.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Honey? (shoving him) Honey? Dad grunts.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Is it hot in here or is it just me?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It's you. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, it feels like a sauna in here.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Would you like me to go down to the garage and turn on the air conditioning?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: No, it's okay. I could lose a few pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad walking like a zombie opens the door to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: THE GARAGE
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Can't see a thing. He tries flicking on the light. No luck, Les unscrewed them. He leaves the garage.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Mom is back under the covers. The TV is on.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Dad opens a drawer, pulls out a flashlight and tests it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD AT THE DOOR TO THE GARAGE
dialogues.text: About to open it, flashlight on. Suddenly... the INTERCOM booms on, startling Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (intercom) Richard? Richard?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. I'm not hot any longer, I'm under the covers now. I'm hungry. Can you make me a herring and mayonnaise sandwich? (beat) With extra bacon bits? Dad suddenly feels ill.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: motors down the highway, being passed by everyone.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: They're still in their corners, hanging onto their pride. Mercedes, asleep or unconscious, is huddled in the backse Les inches up to fifty-four miles per hour, then locks in cruise control. He tries ejecting the cassette. It's stil jammed. He turns it on. Frankie... This is Cadillac cruising at its finest.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: shifts positions, cuddling up against Dean. Guess who's smiling now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac glides along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankie sets the mood. We HEAR a click. A camera flash fills the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES AND LES TURN AROUND
dialogues.text: Mercedes lies on the backseat with her top few buttons undone. A bit of her bra is exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: You asshole! Button up her shirt! Now!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Forget it, Les. Look at us. (gently) At the present moment we're three wild animals bombing down the highway in a Cadillac with the cruise control set on fifty-five.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me, that's the speed limit. I don't need a ticket my first night out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: A ticket? Look at your windshield. We're moving so slowly the flies have time to get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Very funny.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not only that. Listen to this crap. My parents don't even listen to this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Dean, you need a doctor. Dean clicks off another picture.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (reaching back) Gimme the camera, Dean. Dean ignores him, snaps another. Les lunges back, one eye the road. He grabs the camera. They struggle. The Caddie starts to swerve. Charles tries to break them up. In the commotion the camera FLASH goes off right in Les' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: shit! Les is blinded. The car swerves, recklessly. Dean laughs, hysterically. Charles braces himself.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGHWAY AS JIMI HENDRIX WOULD SEE IT
dialogues.text: A purple haze. An EXIT RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car bombs uncontrollably down the ramp headed straigh for a BUSY INTERSECTION. But just ahead, a HUGE PUDDLE, t one Les slept through in class, the one he got wrong on t exam. He jams on the brakes!!!!! What an idiot. Hitting the water, the Caddie SPINS OUT OF CONTROL, and slides throug the intersection BACKWARDS, just narrowly missing traffic (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: whips the car back around. But it doesn't matter, the windshield's a blur, covered in water. A terrified Les fe for the windshield wipers. Got ‘em. Instant vision:

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK'S HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS, yanking the car left, across traffic, through PLYWOOD FENCE, then off:

dialogues.speaker: A VERY STEEP INCLINE
dialogues.text: They're airborne. Dean howls like a cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADDIE GLIDES THROUGH THE AIR
dialogues.text: landing on a muddy hill, cushioning the fall. Temporary relief. Very temporary. Terrified faces, as the car races through high grass, and suddenly explodes into:

dialogues.speaker: THE PARKING LOT OF A SHAKEY'S
dialogues.text: slamming to a stop in a parking space, pulling in perfect next to an OLDER JAPANESE TOURIST COUPLE in a Dodge stati wagon. They pull out as if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Inhaling and exhaling. Glad to be intact, he looks ahead, his hands locked to the steering wheel. In the backseat, Mercedes, still out cold, is mushed on t of Dean. Her lips glisten, a millimeter away from his. Grinning, he stretches to meet Mercedes' lips. We SEE som sign of life in Mercedes. She's waking up. She doesn't lo well. Dean's lips are almost there. Stretching... almost... lip puckered...

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (i11 sounding) I have to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Open the door. Get her out!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Iocan't. I'm trapped. Help me! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mercedes moans. Les jumps out, rips open the back door.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Not in the car, please. Les tears a barely conscious Mercedes off Dean. MERCEDES' P.O.V. -— ROMEO He holds her in his arms. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: practically drops her on the pavement, more worried about car. Charles staggers out of the car, moving as if all hi bones are broken. Dean bounces out.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I apologize for everything, Bro. That was definitely worth the price of admission. In fact, that ride made up for a whole life of boredom. Les surveys THE CAR. Other than the fact that it's covere in grime and dirt, it looks okay.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we? Dean sees something across the street and walks towards i mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: "SICK SAM'S 24 HOUR RENT A CAR"
dialogues.text: A slimy fourth rate organization. It sounds incredible, b up on a very steep ramp, high above the lot, lit with spotlights, under a sign that says, "ONLY $180.00 A WEEK, ar

dialogues.speaker: CADILLAC
dialogues.text: of the one they're driving. Walking closer, it's the same color, same wheels, same everything. Shiny clean, like ne We heat a faint CHORUS OF ANGELS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAR
dialogues.text: Les is still rattled. Charles is better.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I think the muck saved the paint. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercedes, 73.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: We need a car wash, and then we're going home.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (no sympathy) Les, we're almost at Archie's. We can’t turn back now.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (dead serious) We're getting the car washed, and then we're going home. lying half dead on the ground, MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I don't think you want her in your car, Les. I think she's about to blow.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (looking back) He's right. It wouldn't hurt to get her a soda or something.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Look, Les. (pointing out a hose coiled against a wall) There's a hose right over here. While we hose the car down, Charles can go in here with Mercedes and get her something to drink.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Charles?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (somewhat reluctant) Sure. Charles gathers up Mercedes and carries her in the side entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (a gonna’) You have such baby soft skin. Charles blushes. Dean grabs Les by the arm, to walk him o to the sidewalk. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I want you to see something. (motioning to the Caddie on the ramp) Look up there and tell me what's on your mind.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Death.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not you. The car. Does anything strike you as odd?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: It's a Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Not only is it a Cadillac, but it's this one's clone. Exactly the same year, color, wheels, everything.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I just want you to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Dean.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Fine. But just promise me you'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Can we hose the car down, now? They walk back to their Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles and Mercedes in a booth. Slumped over on the tabl Mercedes looks dead. A WAITRESS walking by, gives Charles disdainful look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hosed down, the car looks like new again. Les is relieved (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Have you been thinking about the car?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: What's this all about, Dean?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Just listen to what I have to say and don't interrupt me until I'm through. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Les' reaction echo through the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: MIND
dialogues.text: Everyone looks up.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (outraged) I will not do that! I will not switch cars! You're a nut!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (pleading) You'll never get an opportunity like this again, as long as you live. (beat) We'll cruise up to Archie's without worrying about scratching the paint, dirtying the interior, or smashing the car. Look at the car, Les. Not a scratch. (beat) If you ask me, it's a sign from the Mr. Goodwrench in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I don't believe in Mr. Goodwrench. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: There's still time to convert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les and Dean stand below the Cadillac ramp. lLes' eyes ar getting wider. Les looks

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You worked real hard for that license you have in your wallet. You've had sixteen years of humiliation, begging for lifts from people who couldn't give a shit about your image. That wasn't easy. I know. You had to stand and watch as all the pretty girls in our grade drove away smiling in some older jerk's car, and grin and bear it when the girl of your dreams asked you what kind of car you drove. But that's all over now. (beat) That thing in your wallet is not just an ordinary piece of paper, Les. It's a license, an automobile license. But it's not even just an automobile license, it's a license to live. Did you hear me, Les? A license to live, to be free, to go wherever you want, whenever you want, with whoever you choose. That license in your pocket is the single most liberating document you'll come across in your whole life. I would die to have one. ahead. I think he's sold.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les, to live in fear, is not to live at all.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: What about getting the car back?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: A breeze. If the attendant's awake, we use Charles as a decoy. He looks old enough.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny and sleazy. Les and Dean's reflection CAN BE SEEN in the window. A radio plays some easy listening music. An o timer with a single strand of hair slicked back lounges i his chair, fast asleep. His name tag reads, SICK SAM. A REVOLVER sits in a half open desk drawer. Les and Dean do see it. The CADILLAC KEY is clearly marked, on the board above hi Opposite the board, there is a hole for people to talk through. Dean tries the door. It's locked. He looks at Le as if to say, "At least we tried." Les signals for him to wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUNK
dialogues.text: as it lifts open. The blanket, and cooler, and the golf clubs. Les reaches into the golf bag and pulls out a BALL FETCHER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball fetcher extends through the hole, barely graspin the Cadillac key. As Les gently pulls it back, the keys f and land on Sick Sam's shoulder. They sit there like bird shit. Les maneuvers the ball fetcher like a fine surgeon, lifti the keys off Sick Sam's shoulder. He pulls them out. A bi sigh. Dean reaches into the office and turns up the radio

dialogues.speaker: LES RUNS UP THE RAMP
dialogues.text: and gets inside the car. The interior is so white, it's eerie. He slips the Caddie into neutral, and carefully ro it down the ramp, backwards. Dean pushes him out of the l INT. SHAKEY’S - NIGHT A bored Charles, a couple of cokes, and Sleeping Beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandfather's Cadillac rests on the ramp just as the othe one did. Only this one has a front license plate that rea GRANDPA. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AT THE OFFICE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Les switches the rental key with Grandpa's key, and then attaches it to the ball fetcher. He reinserts it in throu the hole, and places it back up on the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les and Dean, all smiles, quietly get into the Caddie. Th drive across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving. Les carries a green Mercedes. Dean holds a steam hot slice of pizza. A perplexed Charles carries the cokes

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUNK
dialogues.text: It flips open.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (o.8.) I don't know if this is a good idea. Les holds Mercedes. Charles and Dean remove the clubs and the cooler.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Ina half hour there's gonna be babes all over us. She'll kill it for us. As Les places her down in the trunk, she opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Holding her. He smiles. Looks like Gene Kelly. He lays he down gently, and then covers her with the blanket. She ma as well be in her own bed. She's in another world.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: In all your life, did you ever imagine you'd see a Mercedes fit in the trunk of a Cadillac?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I feel bad. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: For her? That trunk is bigger than my bedroom. Les gently lowers the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (sweet) Turn the light off, Daddy. The trunk closes. The SCREEN BECOMES BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Factories, plants, warehouses... The Caddie speeds along.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Pepsi cups on the dash. ROCK on the RADIO. Les is a new Man. Charles is very confused. Dean, wearing funky sunglasses and a corny golf visor, is stretched out in th backseat between the golf clubs and the cooler. He stuffs his face with pizza.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: The radio works.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I fixed it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Whoops, I just dropped some pizza on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Leave it, Deano. I'll get it later.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What's going on? An hour ago you were afraid one of us would fart in here, and now you don't even flinch when Dean drops tomato sauce on the seats. Don't you care about what happens to the car?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (a la Dean) Sure I care. But, there's something special about tonight, Charles... (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LES (cont'd) about Mercedes, about the car surviving the spinout without even a scratch, about us, being in a car, alone, without any parents. (beat) Charles, we've been waiting for this night for sixteen years. If I have to worry about farts and tomato sauce now, when I'm twenty- five I'll be living in a room with rubber walls. Dean leans over, CRANKS THE VOLUME UP, HOWLS with excitem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sick Sam, snoring now, leaning way back in his chair, flinches and sends his chair tipping over backwards. He wakes up, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, wide awake, finishes her herring and mayonnaise sandwich. Dad tries to sleep. Late night news is on TV. A FEMALE CORRESPONDENT stands in a CROWD OF PROTESTERS. The circle peacefully with placards, rhythmically chanting: “ ARE ONE WITH THE INFINITE SUN, FOREVER AND EVER AND EVER.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: I'm standing outside the gates of Allied Technologies, where a group of peaceful protesters have gathered to demonstrate against the late night transportation of military hardware through our city streets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the gates of ALLIED TECHNOLOGIES. Dozen of PROTESTERS hold hands and chant. Several POLICE CARS pull up. Police step out and disperse. Natalie looks on nervously. Karl chants. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Karl, I don't have a good feeling about this. Can we go home?

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: Go home? Natascha, we can't be patsies to the military industrial complex. The survival of the planet is in our hands. She isn't sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac zips by, on its way to:

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE'S ATOMIC BROILER
dialogues.text: High tech fifties, it's more fantastic than Dean describe It's the most spectacular curb service hangout on the pla Rock and Roll blasts through the sound system. Beautiful people dance, mingle, and lean up against their stylish, squeaky clean cars, sipping cokes and eating ice cream sundaes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pull to a stop on the lip of its entrance, their faces ag their mouths hang open. We HOLD AT A DISTANCE as the Cadd pulls into Archie's and parks beside a WHITE STUDEBAKER that's pulling out. They get out to order.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Chrome glistens. You can see your reflection on every surface, it's more than immaculate. And the women... More than any man can handle, even Dean. Busty, curvaceous "TARTS" on roller skates, their hair flowing in the wind, whisk in between and around the cars. Dean spots THREE SUGAR SWEET GIRLS staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: (to Les and Charles) Order for me, I'll get dessert. Dean veers off. The girls smile at him when they see him coming. Les and Charles get on line to order.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO TRAYS slide out, overflowing with golden french fries juicy burgers, and bubbly cokes... a carbonated mist. Charles and Les step away from the counter with their tra They walk back to the Caddie and attach the trays to the windows. They get:

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Dean jumps in, all smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: It's all set, they'll be here ina couple of minutes. One for each of us. A BLACK CAR pulls in beside them, while Les passes out th fries and the cokes, placing his and Charles' on the dash

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I'll never doubt you again, Dean.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: My dreams never get this good.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: My fantasies never get this good. And this is only the beginning. As Charles reaches for the burgers, the SALT SHAKER goes flying. Dazed and starving, Charles swings open the door. CHINK as the door slams open against the car they're park beside. They turn:

dialogues.speaker: IT'S THE BLACK GTO
dialogues.text: Charles stands there looking silly. The INSANE DRIVER and his TWO CRAZY FRIENDS, swigging on bottles of whiskey, ge out of the GTO and surround Charles. He wilts back into t Caddie, slamming the door behind him. Some of the food fa off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Dean can't believe what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Jesus. It's those maniacs from the party. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (panicking) Roll up the windows! Quick! Roll them up! As the window zips up, Dean reaches for a burger, and jus barely grasps one. The window closes on his hand and the burger.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Charles, you spasticated idiot. The window zips down and up. Dean pulls his hand in and d the burger. The burgers and sundaes are still on the tray They watch like kittens as the three DROPOUTS inspect:

dialogues.speaker: THE DAMAGE
dialogues.text: There's definitely A PAINT CHIP. Nothing major, but enoug for three homicidal maniacs to slaughter three innocent k over. While the two buddies stare maniacally at Charles, the dr reaches into the car and pulls out the baddest looking TI IRON you've ever seen. He signals with his index finger f the boys to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (starting the car) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing, Les? You can't back away from these motherfuckers, they're just toying with you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Dean, those motherfuckers are MOTHERFUCKERS. I wouldn't mess with them or anyone related to them. The Driver, swinging the tire iron, jumps up on the front hood. At the same time the THREE SWEET GIRLS Dean picked approach the Caddie. Dean ducks. Les pops the car into reverse and fishtails out. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Driver holds on as long as he can. Then he goes flyin off the hood. The food goes flying off the trays. The French fries and cokes on the dash jerk back on the seats The two crazy friends laugh as the Caddie retreats with t trays attached to the windows like toy wings. The Driver gets up, angrier than hell. The buddies shiver in their boots. The Driver jumps into the car. They're coming afte Les.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Les races away. Dean wants to cry. He turns. The girls stand confused. Archie's fades in the distance. Charles spots the dropouts getting into their car.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Shit! They're coming after us. Les floors it. Cutting right across the path of a cop CAR pulling into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: THE GTO DRIVER
dialogues.text: revs his engine, then squeals back, without looking... SM Direct hit into the CAR. They're not going anywhere. PUSH IN ON the GTO Driver. He looks back at the GTO's damage, watches as the Cadillac speeds away, cutting down a side street. He wants blood. The driver of the smashed car loo at the damage on his car then at the GTO driver. Sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddie bombs down the street like a terrified cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost. The Caddie sits at a fork in the road. The light inside the car is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean looks over the directions his brother gave him.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Shoot me. Hang me. What can I say? The directions were for getting there, not for running away. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (tired of Dean's attitude) Well, it really doesn't matter at this point, does it? Which way should we go?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN CHARLES
dialogues.text: Left. Right. Les shakes his head. We WATCH as the car veers to the right, and follow it as goes down the street and stops at a corner.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Les looks ahead, curiously.

dialogues.speaker: A PROCESSION OF TOW TRUCKS
dialogues.text: travel in front of him, from right to left. Each one tows car: pickup trucks, Volkswagen Beetles, old tired-looking American cars, all with faded paint. And then a showroom 5000 TURBO, just like Les' mom's.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (o.s8.) That AUDI looks just like my mother's. We HOLD ON it, then turn right, against the procession. Ahead, we SEE a CROWD OF PEOPLE, a TV CREW, and some POLI CARS.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (o.s8.) What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fervor grows in intensity. A sense of anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Here they come! Here they come!

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (on a bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE...
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Karl and a frightened Natalie join hands with the others, looking up the road.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: leads a huge-convoy of:

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY HALF TRACKS
dialogues.text: Five of them. Massive. The length of two football fields. The hose from a Titan missile sticks out from a camouflag tarp, almost extending over the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Fear and confusion. Ahead, some ANGRY PROTESTERS lie on t road, blocking their way, while others run towards the Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddie trudges along, as protesters swarm the car and convoy.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (on a bullhorn)

dialogues.speaker: IMMEDIATELY
dialogues.text: Karl, dragging Natalie, runs with the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car rocks. The guys hang on for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: HANDS SLAPPING THE WINDOWS
dialogues.text: Angry faces. One of them is Karl.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I know that guy. He's my sister's He sees his sister. She doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (blown away) Oh shit! My sister! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Duck! If she sees us, I'm finished. Natalie is beside Karl, as he bangs on the hood like a maniac. Les peeks up. Karl's face is pressed against the driver's side window. Natalie sees Les. He sees her. She's in shock. Les pleads through the glass, mouthing everything, making sure she'l understand.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Please! I beg of you! Don't tell Daddy! I'll do anything! I promise! Natalie tries to get Karl to stop. In the b.g. we SEE Les pleading, mouthing, "Please..."

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: Les! What are you doing?!!! You don't even have a...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: we SEE her mouth "license," but we don't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: inches by Natalie. She looks at Les in an almost envious manner, wishing she were there instead of here. We hear POLICE SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live. Behind the reporter, the Cadillac crawls o.s.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: As you can see behind me, what started as a peaceful protest, has now mushroomed into a substantial demonstration. Mom and Dad sleep soundly.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac speeds away from the demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (panicked) You don't know my sister, Dean. She's been waiting for this moment her entire life. When I was seven, she woke my parents out of a deep sleep to tell them I said the word 'fuck.' I've gotta get home.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: How is getting home going to change anything? She saw you. (beat) Does an escaped convict turn himself in when he knows he's going to be executed?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: If his mother is pregnant and expecting any minute? YES! There are no cars at home. My dad will reinvent the guillotine if he finds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops arrest protesters left and right. Karl drags Natalie front of the Half Tracks. He pulls her down to the road, joining others to block the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: (lying down) Natascha, can we please forget the Cadillac and your brother? There are far more significant issues in this world.

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (sitting up) I don't consider my family an insignificant issue. I've gotta get home. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NATALIE (cont'd) With my mother pregnant, there's no possible way my father will let him out with the second car. Suddenly, COPS grab Karl and a shocked Natalie, and yank O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news coverage continues. Dad, half asleep, blindly ai the remote control, trying to turn the TV off. He doesn't notice Karl and a frightened Natalie being led into a PAD WAGON. The TV CLICKS off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddie coasts along. Up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: AN OFFICER
dialogues.text: waves cars over randomly with his flashlight. He signals Caddie. It's a DRUNK DRIVING ROADBLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Les is white. They pull in behind a CAR with its TRUNK FLIPPED OPEN. While the PLASTERED DRIVER leans up against the car, A COP examines his license under a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: This is great. This is really classic.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What are you sweating for Les? A license is like a credit card. Sooner or later, you gotta break ‘em in. Les is stung. A HUGE COP walks to the car, shines his flashlight in Les' eyes, leans in, and inhales deeply. Th cop pauses... All of a sudden, we hear a HICCUP. The boys lock at each other. It's Mercedes. The cop holds his look More hiccups. Dean and Charles pretend it's them.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: (suspicious) License and registration. Les doesn't move. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: License and registration, son.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Les? Give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (shaking) I left my license at home, Sir. Charles and Dean look on in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: Then give me the registration anda piece of I.D. Pulling out his wallet, he hands the cop a SCHOOL I.D. CA

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: This is all I have, Sir. I'm afraid the registration is with my license.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: Alright. Sit tight. The cop jots down the Caddie's license plate number and t returns to his car, where he picks up the radio mouthpiec

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Why didn't you give him your license, Les? What was that you flashed in front of us before?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: My school I.D.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: How could you forget your license your first night out? Les can't hide it any longer...

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I didn't. (cleansing himself) I failed my exam.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES AND DEAN
dialogues.text: You what?! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I failed. I got six wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You mean to tell me you've been driving around all night without a license? Les nods. Dean laughs like a mad man.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: At least you did one smart thing tonight. You stole the car froma family member. They're less likely to press charges. Les and Dean look at each other. Charles knows something' up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops. The huge cop holds Les' I.D.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! This punk doesn't even have a license! The RADIO chatters: Something big is going on.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: We have a full emergency situation at Allied Tech. A possible four- fifteen, riot group... Stand by for instructions.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (raging) You traded cars? You traded cars? Are you guys lunatics? People go to prison for lesser crimes. We have a future ahead of us... transcripts, applications, resumes. This'1ll go on our records. We're scarred for life. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to jail, Charles. We're juveniles.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Speak for yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Charles? Will you take a pill, or something. Nothing's gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys, SPREAD-EAGLED against the car. They're being frisked. Charles gives Dean a look.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE COP
dialogues.text: (to Les) Would you mind opening the trunk for me? The boys swallow at the same time. Les takes the key from the ignition, and walks slowly, very slowly, to the trunk

dialogues.speaker: LES' HAND
dialogues.text: shakes as he tries to fit the key in the key hole.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE COP CAR
dialogues.text: The radio is loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO
dialogues.text: Emergency fifty-four zero five!!! Fifty-four zero five! Maximum assistance is required.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CADILLAC TRUNK
dialogues.text: Les slips the key in. He's about to turn it... Suddenly, hear a VERY LOUD SIREN. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: THE COP
dialogues.text: leaps from his car, siren wailing, screaming and motionin for his partner. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Let's go! Fifty-four zero five in progress!!! The huge cop takes off. As the cop car speeds away, Les doesn't know whether to smile or to cry.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Piece of cake, Les. Let's go get the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tidies up. He pulls out the REVOLVER, checks it, and puts it in his shoulder holster. He then takes the CASH f the register and puts it in a CASH BOX. Humming a happy tune, he reaches along the wall to click a switch. He loo at the lot's sign:

dialogues.speaker: SICK SAM'S 24 HOUR RENT-A-CAR
dialogues.text: The lights behind "24 HOUR" go off. It now reads: "Sick Sam's Rent a Car.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les is parked down the street from the car lot. They can see the "Grandpa" Caddie up on its "throne."

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Now remember, Charles, make it sound like you've got a lot of money to spend, but insist on a test drive. Without one, you're not interested. Can you handle that?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (nervous) Do I have a choice? They both look at him.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Whenever you're ready. Charles hesitates, then gets out of the car. But before h can take two steps, he stops dead in his tracks. In plain sight THE CADILLAC IS BEING BACKED DOWN THE RAMP. Les squeaks. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I am dead. I am so dead, they're gonna have to bury me twice.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE GRANDPA'S CADDIE
dialogues.text: rolling down the ramp. The cash box sits beside Sick Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. They watch the Cadillac squeal out of the lot.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (jamming the car in gear) We don't have any choice. We follow him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: How do you know where he's going and when he'll stop?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: He's got to live somewhere around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les travels a few car lengths behind Sam.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LES' CADDIE
dialogues.text: 6.1 on the nerve scale. The GAS RESERVE LIGHT flashes. They're running out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: (whimpering) Why couldn’t've you have stolen a Honda or a diesel Rabbit, something with better highway mileage?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Charles, I know it's uncomfortable sitting in wet diapers, but can you just quit crying for a minute? (back to business) (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DEAN (cont'd) Les, I'd say at the most, you have thirty miles in the reserve tank, at the least, you have ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam fiddles with the radio. Sinatra:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam passing through a burnt-out slum neighborhood, signal turn off. Les follows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted streets. A ghost town. Scarier and scarier. You wouldn't want to run out of gas here, even in an armored

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LES' CADDIE
dialogues.text: The mileage recorder reads twelve. Les follows a block behind.

dialogues.speaker: SICK SAM
dialogues.text: cuts down a NARROW ALLEY. Les waits a moment, then follow turning off his lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam drives very slowly. At the end of the alley, we SEE a NEON BAR SIGN flickering. Sam drives out of the alley and parks in front of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LES' CADDIE
dialogues.text: Les coasts to the lip of the alley and puts the car in pa

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: I've heard of being hard up for a drink, but this is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: I don't think I'd want to go in there. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I don't think the Terminator would want to go in there.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SAM'S CADDIE
dialogues.text: Sam places the cash box on the floor of the passenger sid under the dash. He gets out and lumbers into the bar.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Dean leans in between Les and Charles. They're strategizi

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (to Dean) As goon as you see me turn the lights on, pull in behind me. And leave his key in the ignition. It's the least we can do.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: What about the hide-a-key? What happens if it's not there?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: It better be there. (beat) Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Les, I was born ready. Les gets out of the car, sprints down the alley and acros the street. Dean jumps over into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les, down on his hands and knees, feels under the back bu of Grandpa's Caddie... Nothing! He runs to the front bump We hear the familiar sound of a REVVED ENGINE. And then w hear "DUM, DUM, DaDUM... DUM, DaDUM, DaDUM, DaDUM." Les lays down as flat as possible, rolling beneath the Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT UNDERNEATH THE CAR
dialogues.text: The tires of the GTO approach just as Les spots the HIDE- KEY BOX. He opens it up. The key sparkles. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: watch as the black GTO, scratched and dented from their d pulls up behind the Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GTO
dialogues.text: Revenge. You can smell it.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Hey, that's the Caddie that fucked us up. Let's thrash it, man. They open their doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy boots, construction boots, the tip of a TIRE IRON, a SLEDGEHAMMER. All of a sudden he hears the shattering o glass.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE DROPOUTS
dialogues.text: kicks in the headlights with his cowboy boot. The driver pounds the bumper with a sledgehammer. The third guy hack off the side mirrors, hubcaps, and the windshield wipers a tire iron.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: cringes with each blow. He can't take it any more. Witha burst of confidence he pops up from beneath the Caddie. Shocked, the dropouts stop their destruction. Les checks the damage. Takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! What the hell do you think you're doing, man? (motioning to the driver holding the sledgehammer ) Gimme that. The driver doesn't move. He's too stunned.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Come on! What are you, attached to it? Gimme it! (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LES (cont'd) (grabbing it out of the driver's hand) You think you geniuses know how to wreck a car? I'll show you turkeys how to fuck one up. Les grabs the sledgehammer and as convincingly as possibl winds up, rolls his eyes, looks for help from God, and smashes the front bumper. To everyone's surprise the bump falls off, crashing to the ground. Les can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: That's how you fuck one up. (pointing to the dislodged side mirror) None if this pansy side mirror shit. My grandmother could knock that off with a walking stick. (throwing the sledgehammer back to the driver) Here's your Teddy Bear back. The dropouts are blown away by Les' performance.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Charles and Dean watch, unbelieving, as the dropouts star close in on Les. Les shuffles backwards, toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: We gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: Les continues his act. They're looking meaner.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Now, I'm gonna walk inside this shit hole, plant my bad ass down at the bar, and get messed up. And when I walk outta here in about twenty minutes you candy-assed faggots better not be playing with my ride. (pointing to the GTO) Otherwise I'm gonna have to show you dudes how a one-man wrecking crew acts when he feels like throwing a party. Les turns, walks away, checking over his shoulder to see their reaction. They don't buy it. They follow him in. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Dean and-Charles slip out of the Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: LES WALKS INTO THE BAR
dialogues.text: He just went from the frying pan into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: AS HE KICKS OPEN THE DOORS TO THE BAR
dialogues.text: This is where death hangs out. Everything stops. The musi the "patrons", even the rats. They all stare. There's not guy in the bar that hasn't belted his girlfriend in the l twenty-four hours. Sick Sam sits in the back corner with WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: walks to the bar, like the town's new sheriff. The floorboards creak beneath his white Reeboks. The dropouts stay back, cautiously. Les may as well be tarred and feathered. TWO BEASTS with their "DEBUTANTE" GIRLFRIENDS make room f Les at the bar. THE BARTENDER, a cross between Ivan the Terrible and Ivan the Worst, leans over; nose to nose wit Les.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: (rough sadistic voice) We just ran out of Kool-Aid. Les chuckles, confidently, trying not to look intimidated

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (dead serious) Bourbon. Straight up. Les turns around to look at all his dead relatives. Nobod in the bar has flinched or said a word. We SEE Dean and Charles looking in from outside. Les turns back to the ba The SHOT GLASS is there, overflowing with bourbon. This is a kid who's never had a drink in his life. He pic it up, checks it against the light, then downs it... It m as well have been Drano. He can't swallow... He SPITS IT OUT across the bar, trying to look macho. Before there ca be any reactions from the peanut gallery... He leans over, an inch from the Bartender. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (imitating the Bartender's voice) I thought you said you ran out of Kool-Aid. The Bartender's confused. Everyone's confused. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: How 'bout something with a little body... something with some heat on it. Challenged, the Bartender reaches under the bar, and pull a three quarter's full bottle of the Devil's mouth wash. There's no label on it, only a FIVE-INCH WORM rests on th bottom. The Bartender pours hima glass. Everyone gathers around him, the dropouts as well. Beads of sweat dot Les' forehead. Sixteen years, all comi down to this moment. Coolly, he pushes the glass aside. CONFUSION. He grabs the bottle. The crowd GASPS! Oddly, h pours the alcohol into his hand, through his fingers. It spills onto the bar, until he's left holding THE WORM in palm of his hand. He takes the worm between his thumb and index finger, til his head back, and in one motion drops it into his mouth swallows. INSTANT RESPECT. A ROAR OF APPROVAL. Within seconds the music is back on and the place returns to "normal." Proudly, Les spins to look out at all his new friends, on to see the DROPOUTS menacingly surround him.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Step outside, worm, we've got a job to finish. Les looks around for help. Forget it. In a joint like thi you have to do more than swallow a worm. He grabs THE BEAST'S beer from the bar behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (shoving The Driver) Back off, man. Don't crowd me.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (stepping towards him to kill him) Why you... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But before the driver can do anything, Les whips the beer over his own shoulder, drenching the Beast behind him. An then he tosses the empty glass at the driver, who, of cou catches it. Les steps aside. The Beast whirls around... a who does he see holding the glass? The driver with his tw buddies on either side of him. The Beast winds up and nails the driver, sending the thre dropouts flying onto a table full of beers. As a MACK TRU at the table is about to hit one of the dropouts, A DEVIL BAR GUY POPS UP IN FRONT OF THE CAMERA, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: BAR GUY
dialogues.text: (excited -- a la John Belushi in "Animal House")

dialogues.speaker: BAR FIGHHHHHHT
dialogues.text: From out of nowhere, the biggest fist you've ever seen punches through the Bar Guy like a drill press. KNOCK OUT Suddenly WW III erupts. Les, dodging heavy artillery, hea for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: Charles and Dean run back to the Caddie. Les jumps into Grandpa's Caddie, starts her up, and takes off. Dean and Charles shoot into the vacant parking space in S Caddie. They bail out with the golf clubs and cooler.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: Sam nonchalantly weaves his way through the fight. He approaches the CIGARETTE MACHINE by the front window. Checking his change, he hears a SCREECH outside the bar. leoks out.

dialogues.speaker: HIS SHINY CADILLAC
dialogues.text: As if nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bombing down the street. Jubilation. Laughter. Dean, now in the front seat, has discovered the cash box. Suddenly, Les HITS THE BRAKES. A FORTY FOOT SKID! Les is white as a ghost. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (shifts into reverse) Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES AND DEAN
dialogues.text: Ohhhhhh shitttttiii¢it:

dialogues.speaker: LES TURNS AROUND
dialogues.text: Sam's Cadillac is a few blocks away. He steps on it, squealing backwards, until he's right beside it.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN AND LES JUMP OUT
dialogues.text: Dean reaches into Sam's Caddie, grabs the key, and opens trunk. Les pulls Mercedes out. Dean puts the key back. Charles throws the cash box into Sam's backseat.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Cradling her again. Gary Cooper smiles. She wraps her arm around him, cuddling, and closes her eyes. Les throws her into the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: Sam turns away from the Bartender with the proper change. Through the window, he sees his open trunk. HE SEES LES getting into the Caddie. AND:

dialogues.speaker: LES SEES HIM
dialogues.text: Les' biggest nightmare. He dives into the car and bullets away.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LES' CADDIE
dialogues.text: Howls. Hoots. They've never been so happy and relieved.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: flies out of the bar, GUN DRAWN. Aiming at the Caddie rac away, he cocks his gun...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: More howls and hoots. There's joy in Mudville. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: We did it! Man, we did it!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: Awesome, Les. That was hall of fame material. BOOM!!! A GUN SHOT blows out the back window. Les looks u in his mirror, and sees Sam standing back in the distance Les makes a quick left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping through the turn, Les clips his back end against pile of garbage cans and a lamp post. His BACK BUMPER GOE FLYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, getting into his shiny Caddie, notices the cash box. relaxes. There's no reason to chase the boys.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE LES' CADDIE
dialogues.text: Mercedes begins to come around. She opens her eyes and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: LES' SMILE
dialogues.text: as he drives with intensity

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (o.s.; feeling the effects) I'm sorry. I must have dozed off. Dean leans over, two inches from her face.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: You didn't miss a thing. She closes her eyes. They laugh like hyenas. INT. PARENT’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Mom lying on top of the covers, WINCES AND GRABS FOR HER STOMACH. She lets the contraction subside. She turns on t light, looks at her watch, then looks over at sleeping Da  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie sirs alone, concerned. Karl chants with a group o protesters. An AGED HIPPIE sings, "Where Have All The Flowers Gone?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles and Dean slip out of the car. Charles gently clos the door. Les looks at a sleeping Mercedes. Dean and Charles look i They whisper to each other.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: License or no license, Mario, that was one intense display of driving.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLES
dialogues.text: You could be the only sixteen-year- old in the country to open a stunt driving school without a license. Les smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: And as far as a first night out with a car goes, you've set the standard. It's gonna be a tough one to top.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Thank God you don't get your license for a few months.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN
dialogues.text: What are you gonna tell Sleeping Beauty?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I don't know. I may not... Mercedes groans, moves around. Les signals silence. The boys freeze. They wave good-byes. Les pulls away. INT. PARENTS' BEDROOM -— DAWN The light is still on. Mom winces and grabs her stomach again. She checks her watch. Another wince. Dad sleeps.
Signs of the sun. Les carries Mercedes to her front door. She groggily relates her perception of the evening to Les

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: The dream was so bizarre, Les. As if I was trapped inside the trunk of a car. And then suddenly the trunk flipped open and there you were, rescuing me. It was so weird.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: It sounds kinda crazy.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: It was, I know it sounds unbelievable. But somehow you were always there, Les, to hold me, like you are right now. I felt so safe and... (touching his cheek) «--SO warm. Les, too in love to speak, stands her up on her doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was such a sleepyhead tonight. (embarrassed) You must have been so bored.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. For me it was non- stop action. Charmed, she moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: When can we go out again?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Right now would be great, She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Honestly? Tonight may be time anyone sees me. actually. the last (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: (concerned) Why? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: It's a long complicated story. I'm not sure you'd want to hear it, Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Does it have a happy ending?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (smiling) It has, so far. She smiles at his allusive compliment and moves even clos

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Hopefully one day I'll get to tell you how it ends... if I live.

dialogues.speaker: MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be waiting, Les. She loves him. He loves her. She gives him the softest sweetest kiss a kid going to the electric chair would eve want. He returns the favor with the most passionate kiss she'd ever want... the kind you break out of prison for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights on. Mom breathes heavily.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Richard. Dad grunts. She pushes him.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Richard, wake up. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les, on a deserted corner, waits for the light to turn gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, half-dressed, ties Mom's shoes up. She winces. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: The baby?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: No. The laces are too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still waiting for the light. Waiting, waiting, it's green

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, shirt hanging out, helps Mom out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Les approaches the house. INT. ANDERSON STAIRWAY —- DAWN Dad helps Mom down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Relax. Just try and breathe naturally. We'll be in the car in two seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dad, no car in sight. The garage door inches open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad helps Mom along, TWO STEPS AWAY FROM THE GARAGE. She looks better. He's the crazy one.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: One more second, we're almost there. He swings the garage door open, without looking inside. Behind him, it's empty. He's about to swing her around, BUT...

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I'm okay. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It must have been gas. False alarm. I feel fine now. I'm sorry. As Dad talks, we SEE the Cadillac coast in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Gas? Are you sure? The car's right here. Dad glances into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I'm positive. It must have been the herring. (feeling guilty) I feel terrible. Dad, about to close the door, notices something.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE GARAGE
dialogues.text: Even with the emergence of daylight, it's still too dark notice the condition of the Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Why is the garage door open?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Maybe Natalie left it open?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Why would she? She took the Audi.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: He sees the Audi is not back. Then he notices the hedges. Locking around, he spots the tire tracks. Shock.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: stands at the lip of the garage, watches. Suddenly... she doubles over in pain. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (gasping) Richard. Forget it. He's in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Richard! Dad turns and sees her hunched over. He runs to her aid.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (walking her to the car) Okay, honey. Just try and breathe normally. We'll be at the hospital in a few... Everything stops; his feet, his voice, his heart... As he walks around the car we can hear his blood boiling. The bumpers. The hubcaps. THE BACK WINDOW! Dad puts his hand through it, unbelieving. He examines the severed antenna, the mutilated wipers, then looks into the car.

dialogues.speaker: LES LYING ON THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: hiding, looking him straight in the eye. A frightened pup

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Ready to explode. Les slithers out the opposite door, awa from Dad, beside Mom.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Is there something wrong with your bed, Les? Les can't speak. Dad walks around the car. Les goes the other way. They circle. Mom stands in between them, leani against the car. She doesn't look well, but there's no stopping Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Would you mind explaining to me what size shark was responsible for this?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I... ah... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad stops. the garage 110.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Les, I don't want to know. I don't want to know. Save it for the judge. (beat) Do you have any notion of what you've done this evening? What this means to your future in this house and on this planet? They're still on opposite sides. Rudy appears at door to the house, wearing his pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I have a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Les, you couldn't even begin to imagine what's in store for you. We had a college fund set aside for you. (glancing at the Caddie) That's gone. You had free room and board, two trusting parents, anda social life. That's gone. You had a TV, a stereo, a baseball glove, a tennis racket, a skateboard, a bicycle. That's all gone. You even had sunlight and a window in your room. That's history. I'm boarding the window up tomorrow. And communication with the outside world? You can forget about that. It's all gone.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (weak) Richard.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Frankly, Les, I don't see what's left... other than school and two bus rides a day.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (stronger) Richard.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: And don't even think about a license. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: Never?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Les, as long as I'm alive and I share the same last you will never, not ever, behind a steering wheel. 111. and you name... sit The only Dad comforts Mom. great pain. Dad looks time you'll get close to one will be on a bus and in your dreams. (beat) All I can say, buddy boy, is that you are damn lucky your mother didn't go into labor tonight!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (hunching over the car) Richard! I am in labor!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (running to her) Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Yes. My water just broke. Loads her into the backseat. She is in Dad tries to close the door. Mom grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Stay here. I want you to be with me.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: In the backseat? Who's gonna drive?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Les can.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (shocked) Les? Les who? Not this Les. No way. Les is staying here. Rudy, get back with your Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Richard, please! It's been nine months. That's long enough. Now let's go. at Mom, then Les. Eye to eye to eye to eye... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (from the heart) I know I let you down, Dad. And I'm as sorry as I can ever be that I disappointed you, but as hard as you try, you can't imagine what I've learned tonight. (beat) Please let me drive, Dad. I can do it. Dad thinks about it... He hands Les the keys, gripping hi hand tight.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (right up to his face) All right, but try and drive like you have a license. Dad lets go of Les' hand and jumps in the back with Mom. Rudy rides shotgun. Les buckles in.

dialogues.speaker: THE MANGLED CADDIE
dialogues.text: backs out of the garage, stops on the street, then squeal away.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Mom is in pain. Dad holds her. Les grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS AND RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, on the phone. Curious, she hangs up. Karl stands beside her, full of life. He doesn't care about her problems.

dialogues.speaker: KARL
dialogues.text: Don't you feel invigorated? This is just the beginning. There are Many wars still to wage. You and I, Natascha. Together we will bring the running dog imperialists to their knees. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE
dialogues.text: (blunter than blunt) Screw off, Karl! And by the way, the name is Natalie, not Natascha! She walks away, leaving a stunned, and at last, speechles Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full speed ahead. NOT A SINGLE CAR IN SIGHT. The light turns yellow, then a quick red. The Caddie's wheels lock. lennnnnng skid. Burnt rubber, as it screeches to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Rudy, Mom, and Dad, REBOUND from the sudden stop.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (pissed off) Les? What the hell are you doing? There's not a damn car in sight.

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: It's a red light.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Les. We're rushing your mother to the hospital, not a bridge game. Go through it! Just get us there. Les smiles, looks both ways, then tries to take off... On one problem: the engine is revving, but the Caddie's not moving.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm pressing on the gas, but it won't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It sounds like the transmission. (frustrated) Try the other gears. Les tries them all. Nothing. Shifting into park, the car JOLTS BACKWARDS as he passes REVERSE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (looking at Dad) Only reverse works. Dad doesn't like it. Mom is in more pain. She winces and groans. Dad feels for her.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. But take it easy. Les loves it. He shifts into reverse, turns to look throu the back window, braces his arm behind the seat, and take off.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Popeye Doyle screeches the car around and peels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddie, in reverse, bombs down the street, its right signal on. In the left lane is a long WEDDING PROCESSION.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Mom is in great pain. Les has to make the turn. He zips u to the front of the line, then makes a sweeping left turn from the middle lane, and because an OLD BLIND WOMAN is shuffling across the street, Les is forced to go up ons:

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Boxed in by parked cars, the Caddie bombs through Sunday papers and Sunday morning brunch tables. A WAITER putting RED tablecloth down on a table dives out of the way, like Matador teasing a bull. The Caddie flies through the tablecloth.

dialogues.speaker: A MOTORCYCLE COP ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: writing out a parking ticket, drops his pencil when he se the Caddie crash down off the sidewalk onto the street joining the traffic. The Cop jumps on his motorcycle, switches on his siren, and rockets away.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: weaving in and out of traffic: left turns, right turns, i incredible. We hear the SIREN. The Cop pulls up beside Le waving for him to pull over. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dad tries to signal to the Cop that Mom's pregnant. The C realizes what's going on. He waves for Les to "follow him but he hasn't been looking ahead. Suddenly, his front tir hits the back bumper of an ANTIQUE CONVERTIBLE. The Cop somersaults over his handle bars into the car's front sea The DRIVER, a red-nosed Irishman, does a double-take, tak leck at the flask he's been nipping on, smiles, and takes another swig.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: bulleting down the street. The hospital is in sight. Les has to catch a yellow light. A WATER MAIN has burst. There's a HUGE PUDDLE. IN REVERSE, Les rockets through th light. Here comes the puddle... Has he learned his lesson

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADDIE
dialogues.text: Les eases his foot off the brake and coasts through. Spra shoots out on either side, and SPLASHES through the back window, soaking Mom and Dad. Rudy loves it. Dad alternate between caring for Mom and fearing for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the street from the hospital. Natalie leaves the precinct. She does a triple-take when she sees her family flash by backwards. She runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: A HUGE TRUCK backs out of a SKYSCRAPER CONSTRUCTION SITE. TOWERING CRANE attempts to lift a HEAVY LOAD OF STEEL GIR from the truck's flatbed. The girders hang out onto the street... The Caddie's headed straight for them. We hear a SCREECH!

dialogues.speaker: THEIR FACES IN THE BACK WINDOW
dialogues.text: Horror, as there's nothing they can do, except pray... te feet, five feet, a foot... Les swoops the car safely arou the girders and then screeches to a stop in a tow zone, i front of the hospital. The emergency driveway is clogged. Natalie runs to the car. TWO ORDERLIES dash out to the car with a WHEELCHAIR. Dad helps Mom out. Rudy and Natalie watch. Les stays in the car. They rush Mom up the walk into the hospital. Dad loo back. Les is standing by the destroyed Caddie, ashamed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (stern) Come here, Les. Les looks down.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Les. Come here! Les sheepishly makes his way over. Dad puts his arm aroun him.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Where did you learn to drive like that?

dialogues.speaker: LES
dialogues.text: (relieved) I don't know, Dad. TI guess last night.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: It must have been some crash course. Les laughs. Dad squeezes him, affectionately. The CAMERA CRANES UP TO a bird's-eye view, high above the scene. Dad with his arm around his son, disappears into the hospital

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (voice over) Maybe we can fix the car before Grandfather gets home. He'll never notice. Suddenly, CONSTRUCTION WORKERS begin shouting, and then running for cover, scattering like ants. From the sky:

dialogues.speaker: THE WHOLE BUNCH OF GIRDERS
dialogues.text: CRASH down on Grandfather's Cadillac, DEMOLISHING it. As the dust settles, the CAMERA CRAWLS its way into the h of junk until we CAN BARELY MAKE OUT the radio-tape deck. hear a click-click. The tape starts to play... Sinatra "That's Life..."
